page.title: 18FLOODING IN THE LUNE VALLEY
page.content: The River Lune floods the riverside pasture on average 6 times per year.The farmhouse and outbuildings of farms with land on the valley floor are sited near the foot of the valley slope safe from flooding and from where a watch can be kept for signs of flooding.When houses were built behind the Fenwick Arms in the 1970's they obscured the view from Shaw House Farm.In 1978 the farmer built a new farmhouse behind his old house to regain his view.He moves his stock inside for a couple of days in the event of a flood.They will not graze the pasture immediately after flooding unless rain has washed the grass.The Claughton and Farleton Beck meet on his land which compounds the problem of flooding.
